result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Vega-Marcon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Vega-Marcon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Vega-Marcon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
*PROBATION review hearing June 3, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 40.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*DNA sample; pay the surcharge.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest. Defendant must remain sober.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
*This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
*2/26/2016  STAY LIFTED as to three days.  Straight time, forthwith.  Commitment for Condition time signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Vega-Marcon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Brian Burke.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation. The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.  Defendant must remain sober.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed on Count 1.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court started to take a plea from the defendant.  Defendant changed his mind and informed the Court he would like to proceed to trial.  Due to the hour of the day, Court ordered matter adjourned.  State revoked the offer.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
*
Case recalled.  Rulings on admissibility of the 911 calls made.  Court will not allow the 1st and 2nd calls in, but the 3rd and 4th calls will be allowed.  Case passed.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/8/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference to select court dates before branch 40. A substitution of Judge has previously been filed (post rotation) in this case. Branch 40 not in session, unable to select new dates. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference before branch 40 to select new dates only. Case remains before branch 23 until August 1st, 2015.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of Defense Counsel, matter not scheduled for today. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for today's hearing only.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed. This is a rotation substitution. Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court, effective 8/1/2015, this case is reassigned pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 44. Court VACATED the Final Pretrial date of 8/7/2015 & Jury Trial date of 8/12/2015. Case set for Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bridget T.   AND/OR   Chaveli T.    AND/OR  their residences   AND/OR  their places of employment

No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Jason Vega-Marcon in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-085

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
